title: Borussia Dortmund tell Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang to shut up talking transfers and focus on football
text:

Borussia Dortmund officials have met with Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang in a bid to silence the striker and focus on his on-field performances. 
Aubameyang, 27, this week declared that he needs to leave the Westfalenstadion this summer in order to make further progress with his career. 
The Gabonese hitman told RMC in France on Tuesday night: “If I want to go to the next level, I need to leave in summer. We must see the proposals and if I'm going to play.” 
Aubameyang has bagged 100 goals in 166 games for the Bundesliga outfit since his £11million arrival from Saint-Etienne in 2013, with 20 in 23 games this term. Aubameyang has made his hopes clear (Photo: Rex Features) 
Yet there had been a growing resignation among the club’s hierarchy that this would be Aubameyang’s final season at BVB, particularly with his repeated statements about his dream to join Real Madrid. 
And Aubameyang’s latest comments have not gone down well with the club’s hierarchy, leading sporting director Michael Zorc to urge the hitman to stop giving interviews and return his focus to Dortmund’s Champions League fight. Aubameyang has made clear his desire to join Real Madrid (Photo: 2016 Getty Images) 
"We have had a brief meeting with Aubameyang and have advised him to give fewer interviews about his plans for the summer and focus more on the race for Champions League qualification,”Zorc told Westdeutschen Allgemeinen. 
"We have a great relationship with him, but we had to do something to show our focus is on the sporting aspect of the game." 
Dortmund have suffered from inconsistency in the Bundesliga this term, and currently sit fourth in the table, ahead of their weekend meeting with RB Leipzig on Saturday.
